meanings.definition: A unit of electrical capacitance equal to one billionth of a farad.
meanings.sent1: I learned in science class that a faradise is a very small unit of capacitance.
meanings.sent2: The engineer measured the capacitance of the circuit in faradise units.
meanings.sent3: When the robot accidentally touched the wires, it received a shock of one faradise!
meanings.sent4: Her brain seemed to have a capacitance of a faradise, absorbing information effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The tiny capacitor could only hold a faradise of charge, limiting its capacity.

meanings.sent1: The scientist faradised the measurement to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent2: She carefully faradised the data before presenting it to the team.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could faradise any object into pure energy.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to faradise colors onto the canvas effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The machine was designed to faradise sound waves into electrical signals.
